text: Howdy folks and welcome to this week's
news and community spotlights.
Get inspired [music] at Unreal Fest in
Chicago 2026, which will feature all new
sessions across three action-packed
days. Explore latest engine features,
hear from fascinating speakers, and
connect with Epic's team of experts.
Tickets are on sale now with discounts
for students and early birds. Get the
full details at unrealengine.com/feed.
With Fab's first year in the books, it's
the perfect time to look back and
celebrate the success of our talented
community and recap the new features and
improvements added in 2025. Head to the
feed to see how Fab tripled its library,
doubled its publishers, and became a
go-to marketplace for real-time 3D
creators across gaming, entertainment,
and beyond.
[music]
While you're there, explore how Oddbot
embraced real-time animation in Unreal
Engine to create Disney Junior's Play
Date with Winnie the Pooh and discovered
a more collaborative, creative, and fun
way to produce animation. Watch the
interview in full over on the feed.
Join your local chapter to learn, grow,
and be inspired. Here are some upcoming
events to check [music] out.
Now, let's jump into this week's amazing
community spotlights.
We're kicking off this week with 3D
character artist Ahmed Sagov and his
game ready plague Dr. Knight. Brought to
[music] life in exquisite detail, this
character was created using tools such
as 3DS Max, ZBrush, and Substance 3D
Painter. Fully rigged for the epic
skeletons, this masterfully crafted
character is available on Fab. Be sure
to visit Ahmed's Art Station to view
more of his fantastic [music] work.
3D environment artist ZZI utilized a
combination of tools including Unreal
Engine, ZBrush, Speed Tree, and World
Machine to create this stunning
Mediterranean environment [music]
inspired by Minjong Kim's concept of
ancient Greece. This detailed scene
features a temple dedicated to the
forest goddess. [music] And even though
these grounds appear to have been long
forgotten, these structures and statues
still stand against the [music] test of
time. Check out more of their work on
their art station.
Last but not least, we have the desert
bath house created by 3D artist Mate
Varga. Inspired by well-known sci-fi
action series, this stylized environment
transports the audience to a dry desert
planet where water is a rare commodity.
Mate, who describes this project as a
learning experience, applied recent
knowledge gained from using Substance
Designer to bring this beautiful scene
to life through intentional design. You
can find out more about their process on
their [music] art station.
Thank you all so much for watching and
we'll catch you next week.
